references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a highly influential multi-modal model that aligns images with text descriptions, which is foundational to the proposed method's proxy word learning approach.
This paper addresses the challenge of multiple clustering, providing a baseline method and establishing this area as a significant problem which the proposed method aims to improve upon.

This paper presents ENRC, a deep multiple clustering method that uses auto-encoders to learn features and optimize a clustering objective, representing a state-of-the-art technique that the proposed method aims to surpass.

references.paper_title: AugDMC: Data augmentation guided deep multiple clustering
references.reason: This paper introduces AugDMC, another state-of-the-art deep multiple clustering method that uses data augmentation to generate diverse image aspects and learn representations; a direct competitor to the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Stable cluster discrimination for deep clustering
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel method for deep clustering, focusing on improving clustering stability and performance; offering another recent advance in the field which the proposed method builds upon.
